body:
seems your video may be corrupted;  you can run this to find out:
https://github.com/DeepLabCut/DeepLabCut/issues/982#issuecomment-723480607

Thank you for pointing me to this, but I'm having trouble using the vid reader (see below). I did try updating DLC to the newest beta version (2.2b8), as recommended in that string, but I get the same error. I apologize if I'm screwing something up, I'm not super proficient with coding.

Separately, I have run the Analyze Video function on a number of videos from the same source, and it always analyzes the same number of frames (112) regardless of the video length. Would it be possible that all the videos are corrupted and with the same number of good frames?

Error with vid reader:

(base) PS C:\Users\SNRC_Z42> conda activate DLC-GPU
>>
(DLC-GPU) PS C:\Users\SNRC_Z42> from deeplabcut.utils.auxfun_videos import VideoReader
At line:1 char:1
The 'from' keyword is not supported in this version of the language.
    + CategoryInfo          : ParserError: (:) [], ParentContainsErrorRecordException
    + FullyQualifiedErrorId : ReservedKeywordNotAllowed

first you need to just activate a python session:
```python
conda activate DLC-GPU

(DLC-GPU) PS C:\Users\SNRC_Z42> ipython 

[1] import deeplabcut

[2] from deeplabcut.utils.auxfun_videos import VideoReader
```

Thank you for your help! The videos were corrupted. I took the suggestion of the user in the former issue string you provided, which was opening the videos with a video editing software and resaving them, and this worked. I used Kinovea.

issue.title: Missing most of my video for DeepLabCut after video Analysis step

repository.name: DeepLabCut
repository.description: Official implementation of DeepLabCut: Markerless pose estimation of user-defined features with deep learning for all animals incl. humans

license.name: GNU Lesser General Public License v3.0

issue.body:
I ran a 6 minute long video through the DeepLabCut program, Colab_TrainNetwork_VideoAnalysis.ipynb. Every step worked fine, until I got to the end and saw that the labeled video was only 1 second long, the first second of the original video. I noticed that during the analysis step, the number of frames went down from 23512 to 58, and I don’t know why this happened.

Below is the following code that was generated. Below that is my config file for any additional information that might be needed. I have never ran into this issue before, please let me know if there are any fixes for this.

issue.title: ValueError: Dataset(s) incompatible with Pandas data types, not table, or no datasets found in HDF5 file

repository.name: DeepLabCut
repository.description: Official implementation of DeepLabCut: Markerless pose estimation of user-defined features with deep learning for all animals incl. humans

license.name: GNU Lesser General Public License v3.0

issue.body:
Hi there. I am running into some issues with the steps after `analyze_videos`
I run `deeplabcut.analyze_videos(config_path,[‘Full path of video or video folder’], shuffle=1, videotype=‘.MP4’)`
Here is the output of `analyze_videos`:

The output of the files (such as the .h5) has 1.0 kB, which makes me think they look OK, despite the above step happening really fast (correct me if I'm wrong!)

And then when I run `deeplabcut.filterpredictions(config_path,[‘video_path’], videotype=‘.MP4’)` I get this error: 

```
`In [73]: deeplabcut.plot_trajectories(config_path,['/home/quantum/Documents/name/videos/GH012794_CF1_var.MP4'])
Loading  /home/quantum/Documents/name/videos/GH012794_CF1_var.MP4 and data.

    397             if len(groups) == 0:
    398                 raise ValueError(
--> 399                     "Dataset(s) incompatible with Pandas data types, "
    400                     "not table, or no datasets found in HDF5 file."
    401                 )

ValueError: Dataset(s) incompatible with Pandas data types, not table, or no datasets found in HDF5 file.
`
```
Any suggestions? This is my first time using github so I'm happy to provide additional details. Thanks for your help and for the awesome software. 
Desktop details: 
Ubuntu 20.04 LTS
Graphics: NVIDIA Quadro RTX 5000 (2 GPUs)
Memory: 124 Gb
Disk: 2 Tb

issue.title: Multi-animal DeepLabCut Colab only Analyzes first few seconds of video

repository.name: DeepLabCut
repository.description: Official implementation of DeepLabCut: Markerless pose estimation of user-defined features with deep learning for all animals incl. humans

license.name: GNU Lesser General Public License v3.0

issue.body:
I have tried to use the Multi-Animal Colab for DeepLabCut to analyze a 5-6 minute video. I complete all the correct steps, but when I get to the Analyze step, it only analyzes the first couple seconds of the video, but nothing after that. This is an issue that has popped up multiple times and I haven't gotten an answer as to what the issue could be. My video has 22287 total frames, but only 58 of them are detected. Why is it only detecting 58 when it knows there are way more:

Below is the code:

Using snapshot-42000 for model /content/drive/My Drive/Mouse Cohort-Nicole-2020-12-30/dlc-models/iteration-0/Mouse CohortDec30-trainset95shuffle1
Initializing ResNet
Analyzing all the videos in the directory...
Starting to analyze %  /content/drive/My Drive/Mouse Cohort-Nicole-2020-12-30/videos/GOPR1561.mp4
/content/drive/My Drive/Mouse Cohort-Nicole-2020-12-30/videos  already exists!
Loading  /content/drive/My Drive/Mouse Cohort-Nicole-2020-12-30/videos/GOPR1561.mp4
  0%|          | 0/22287 [00:00<?, ?it/s]Duration of video [s]:  371.82 , recorded with  59.94 fps!
Overall # of frames:  22287  found with (before cropping) frame dimensions:  1920 1080
Starting to extract posture
Detected frames:  58
  1%|          | 222/22287 [00:23<38:49,  9.47it/s]

issue.title: Analyze videos not tracking the end of videos

repository.name: DeepLabCut
repository.description: Official implementation of DeepLabCut: Markerless pose estimation of user-defined features with deep learning for all animals incl. humans

license.name: GNU Lesser General Public License v3.0

issue.body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues

### Bug description

Hi DeepLabCut!

We are having some issues when we run analyze videos on novel videos. 
We are creating a new folder (novel_videos) within the videos folder of the DLC project (so permissions are fine). We are selecting a video and stating how many animals are present and asking to create a video and save results as a CSV. The code runs fine with no errors and videos show tracking throughout the video. All the progress bars shown by the python terminal reach 100%. However, the CSV's are 'giving up' towards the end of videos, showing no tracking at all for any individuals after x number of frames. The excel sheet shows the correct number of frames, but simply stops tracking after X number of frames. 
(Also please note for 1 video it has done this at the start, not the end of the video. with the first 2 seconds being completely blank, despite the animal being tracked in the video).

I tried deleting and re-running but got the exact same issue, with it cutting off at the exact same spot.
I have checked and the videos are not corrupt (using your fix in issue https://github.com/DeepLabCut/DeepLabCut/issues/1001) 
I have lowered my p-cut off and the minimal number of connections. 

Do you have any idea why the CSV's are dropping these numbers? 
As always, thank you in advance for your help :)

### Operating System

windows

### DeepLabCut version

v2.2.0.6

### DeepLabCut mode

multi animal

### Device type

GPU (hp z book) 

### Steps To Reproduce

1. Use GUI to open project
2. Analyze videos tab
3. Select a novel video and tell DLC there are 2 animals present 
4. Ask dlc to create video and CSV
5. Code runs without issue 
6. Video tracks 'fine' (tracking can be bad for our very noisy data, however points still present across entire video) 
7.  Check CSV, 'cuts off' towards end of video giving no more data points

### Relevant log output

```shell
Using snapshot-200000 for model C:\Users\cw266\Videos\ml_comparison_4-Charlotte-2022-03-11\dlc-models\iteration-0\ml_comparison_4Mar11-trainset95shuffle1
```
